docs.lead_paragraph: The New York Civil Liberties Union charged yesterday that the state law providing compulsory treatment for narcotic addicts was totally inadequate and that compulsory confinement was nothing more than imprisonment.

headline.main: Suit Filed to Void State Narcotics Treatment Law

docs.abstract: ACLU NY chap charges NYS compulsory treatment law is totally inadequate, that compulsory confinement is imprisonment; sues NYS Narcotic Addiction Control Comm and members to free 4 men involuntarily confined in Beacon, NY, center; includes affidavit by Dr S Portnow backing claim that there is no known cure for addiction; ACLU atty N Fabricant describes treatment
docs.snippet: The New York Civil Liberties Union charged yesterday that the state law providing compulsory treatment for narcotic addicts was totally inadequate and that compulsory confinement was nothing more than imprisonment.

keywords.value: RACIAL INTEGRATION - PROGRAMS FOR SOCIALLY HANDICAPPED

docs.lead_paragraph: Never in the 22 years since the establishment of the Albert Lasker Medical Research Awards has the choice of the winners been more exciting than this year.

headline.main: The Lasker Winners; Choices for This Year's Awards Called Most Exciting Since They Were Started

docs.snippet: Never in the 22 years since the establishment of the Albert Lasker Medical Research Awards has the choice of the winners been more exciting than this year.
